contextId.information: Nathan refers to David in the third person. This is a way of showing respect to the king. It can be stated in second person. AT: "Have you, my master the king, done this without telling us, your servants, who should sit on the throne after you?" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
contextId.quote: Has my master the king done this without telling us, your servants, who should sit on the throne after him?

contextId.information: Solomon speaks of himself as "your servant" to show that he respects Yahweh. This can be stated in first person. AT: "that I, your servant, will pray" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])

Yahweh is speaking to Baasha, and the phrase "his family" refers to Baasha's family. This can be translated using the words "you" and "your." AT: "Listen, Baasha. I will completely sweep away you and your family" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
contextId.quote: See, I will completely sweep away Baasha and his family

contextId.information: Jehoshaphat refers to Ahab in the third person to show respect for him. AT: "You should not say that" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
contextId.quote: May the king not say that
